page.title: 13COMMUNITY SPIRIT
page.content: Mothers often join together to organise entertainment for children, sometimes combining it with fund raising. In this way the Village Hall is often used for discos and celebrations such as Hallowe'en and Guy Fawkes evenings, to which all are welcome. The former village policeman uses the local Lions' mini-bus to take children to Alton to swim on Friday evenings. A local care group, to which anyone may belong, attempts to meet any call for help within the community, particularly with transport. Examples of those helped are those who wish to visit relations in hospital or to keep hospital appointments. The account of someone very much involved in the community follows.
